Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Scout \Scout\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Scouted}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Scouting}.] 1. To observe, watch, or look for, as a scout; to follow for the purpose of observation, as a scout. [1913 Webster]
Take more men, And scout him round. --Beau. & Fl. [1913 Webster]
2. To pass over or through, as a scout; to reconnoiter; as, to scout a country. [1913 Webster]
scouting n : exploring in order to gain information; "scouting in enemy territory is very dangerous" [syn: {exploratory survey}, {reconnoitering}, {reconnoitring}]
